provisions.title: Prohibition on Dissemination of Intimate Images and Personal Information Posted Without Consent
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from disseminating Intimate Images or Personal Information through a website or online service without providing clear and conspicuous notice to each depicted individual and obtaining their verifiable affirmative express written consent, including the right to revoke consent at any time.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Disposition of Personal Information and Intimate Images
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from selling, using, or otherwise benefitting from Personal Information or Intimate Images obtained without written consent, and must destroy all such material in his possession within 30 days of entry of this Order, except as required by law or government agency request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Prohibition on Charging Takedown Fees
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from charging any consumer any fee related to removing or taking down Personal Information or Intimate Images from any website, whether directly or through an intermediary.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Additional Conduct Prohibitions
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from setting up merchant processing accounts for any business entity unless he actually controls or has knowledge of its daily operations, and from serving as an officer, director, or manager of any entity unless he actually controls or has knowledge of its ordinary operations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment and Partial Suspension
provisions.summary: A judgment of $205,000 is entered against Defendant; $15,000 must be paid within 7 days of entry via electronic fund transfer, after which the remainder is suspended contingent on the accuracy of Defendant's financial representations. The suspension may be lifted if Defendant is found to have made material misstatements in those representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all interest in assets transferred under this Order; Complaint facts may be taken as true in future proceedings; money paid to the Commission may be used for equitable relief including consumer redress, with any remainder deposited to the U.S. Treasury as disgorgement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with Plaintiff representatives in this case and related investigations, including providing truthful information and appearing for interviews, depositions, hearings, and trials upon 5 days' written notice, without a subpoena.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must acknowledge receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies to relevant business personnel within specified timeframes for 3 years after entry, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt from each recipient within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report 1 year after entry of the Order detailing contact information, business activities, and compliance status; must submit sworn change notices within 14 days of any change in name, address, business role, or entity structure for 20 years; and must notify the Commission within 14 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create certain business records for 15 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, and all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: Plaintiffs are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through additional compliance reports, depositions, document production, direct communications, undercover testing, and consumer reporting agency records; Defendant must respond to written requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Chapter 598 of the Nevada Revised Statutes

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent, expressly or by implication, its security or privacy practices, how it handles Personal Information or Health Information, its membership in any privacy/security programs, or any government approvals of its products or services.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent for Disclosure of Health Information to Third Parties
provisions.summary: Respondent must not disclose any Health Information to any Third Party unless it first obtains the Affirmative Express Consent of the individual identifiable by that Health Information, except as required by law.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Destruction of Saliva Samples
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of the Order's issuance, Respondent must instruct laboratories to destroy retained physical DNA saliva samples held more than 180 days after Respondent accepted analysis results, and must provide sworn written confirmation of those instructions to the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $75,000 to the Commission within 8 days of the Order's effective date by electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Respondent relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, agrees that Complaint facts may be taken as true in subsequent enforcement proceedings, and acknowledges the Commission's authority to use paid funds for consumer redress or related relief, with interest accruing on any default.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Respondent must provide sufficient customer information to enable the Commission to administer consumer redress to all Covered Customers, and must supply any additional redress-related information requested by the Commission within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within 10 days, deliver copies to all relevant personnel within 10 days (and before new personnel assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit an initial compliance report on saliva sample destruction within 90 days, a comprehensive annual compliance report one year after issuance, compliance notices within 14 days of specified changes, and notice of any bankruptcy filing within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create and retain specified records for 20 years after the Order's issuance (retaining each for at least 5 years), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, privacy/security representations, consent documents, Assessment materials, and all compliance records.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting additional reports, records, and interviews, and may use other lawful means including posing as consumers or suppliers without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is final and effective upon publication on the FTC's website and terminates 20 years from its issuance date, or 20 years from the most recent date the Commission files a complaint alleging any violation of the Order, whichever is later.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Prevention of CSAM and NCM
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from misrepresenting the extent to which they review, remove, prevent, or protect consumers from CSAM and NCM on their Covered Services.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Mandated Suspension of Content
provisions.summary: Defendants must suspend all pre-program Model-uploaded content where age verification or consent has not been confirmed, and all pre-program Content Partner content not meeting required safeguards, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Mandated Program to Prevent the Posting and Proliferation of CSAM and NCM
provisions.summary: Defendants must establish and implement a comprehensive CSAM and NCM Prevention Program within 90 days, including documentation, governance, risk assessment, safeguards (age/consent verification, content review, removal processes), training, reporting tools, and biannual transparency reports.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: CSAM and NCM Prevention Program Assessments by a Third Party
provisions.summary: Defendants must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party assessments of their CSAM and NCM Prevention Program, with specific assessor qualifications, reporting periods, assessment content requirements, and submission deadlines.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Cooperation with Third-Party CSAM and NCM Prevention Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendants must cooperate fully with the CSAM and NCM Prevention Assessor by providing all relevant information, access to content management systems, and accurate disclosures without misrepresentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Annual Certifications – CSAM and NCM Prevention
provisions.summary: Defendants must annually provide the FTC and the Division with a CEO certification attesting to compliance with Provisions I–V and disclosure of any uncorrected material noncompliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Notice to Users
provisions.summary: Defendants must post the court-mandated consumer notice (Exhibit A) prominently on all Covered Service landing pages within 14 days of Order entry and maintain it for 2 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A $15 million civil penalty judgment is entered in favor of the Utah Division; $5 million is due within 7 days of Order entry; the remaining $10 million is suspended conditional on compliance and may be reinstated upon contempt finding.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendants relinquish all rights to assets transferred under the Order; Complaint facts are taken as true in future enforcement proceedings; bankruptcy nondischargeability elements are established; Defendants must provide Tax Identification Numbers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must acknowledge receipt of the Order under penalty of perjury within 7 days, deliver copies to principals, officers, and relevant employees within specified timeframes, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a sworn compliance report one year after Order entry, sworn compliance notices within 14 days of any structural or contact changes for 10 years, and bankruptcy filing notices within 14 days, using specified submission procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create specified records for 10 years after Order entry and retain each such record for 5 years, covering accounting, personnel, consumer complaints, compliance documentation, advertising materials, privacy representations, assessment materials, and law enforcement communications.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Division are authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through requests for reports and documents, depositions, direct communications, interviews, undercover monitoring, and all lawful compulsory process; Defendants may not take actions to evade the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Utah Consumer Sales Practices Act, Utah Code § 13-11-1 et seq.

provisions.title: Injunction Against COPPA Rule Violations and Privacy Policy Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant and all persons acting in concert with it are permanently enjoined from violating any provision of the COPPA Rule and from failing to comply with any representations made in privacy policies about the collection, use, or disclosure of children's personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy — FTC KidzPrivacy Notice
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Consent Decree, defendant must place a clear and conspicuous bold-typeface hyperlink notice pointing to www.ftc.gov/kidzprivacy in both its posted website privacy policy and its direct privacy notices sent to parents.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Civil Penalty — $30,000 Payment
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a $30,000 civil penalty by certified or cashier's check on the date of entry of the Consent Decree; default triggers accrual of interest on the unpaid balance.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Deletion of Unlawfully Collected Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Within ten days of entry, defendant must delete all personal information collected from children without parental authorization through www.lisafrank.com and shop.lisafrank.com from April 21, 2000 through the date of entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Initial Distribution of Consent Decree and Compliance Guide (Current Personnel)
provisions.summary: Within thirty days of entry, defendant must provide copies of the Consent Decree and FTC compliance guide to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees/agents, obtain signed acknowledgments, and submit a compliance statement to the Commission within ten days thereafter.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Ongoing Distribution of Consent Decree and Compliance Guide (Future Personnel)
provisions.summary: For three years after entry, defendant must provide copies of the Consent Decree and compliance guide to future principals, officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees/agents within thirty days of them assuming their position, obtain signed acknowledgments, and retain those records.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting to the Commission
provisions.summary: Within 120 days of entry and at such other times as the FTC requires, defendant must file a detailed written compliance report covering privacy notices, parental consent procedures, information collection practices, and data security procedures.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: For five years after entry, defendant must maintain and make available to the FTC within fifteen days of request print or electronic copies (in HTML format) of all documents demonstrating compliance, including information collection forms, web pages, and representations about data practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Notice of Business Changes
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the FTC at least thirty days before any business change that may affect compliance obligations under the Consent Decree, including mergers, dissolutions, bankruptcy filings, and name or address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Taxpayer Identifying Number Disclosure
provisions.summary: Defendant must furnish its taxpayer identifying number to the FTC in accordance with 31 U.S.C. § 7701 for purposes of collecting and reporting on any delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Address for Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: All reports, submissions, and notices required by Paragraphs 13–18 must be sent by certified mail to the Associate Director, Division of Advertising Practices, Bureau of Consumer Protection, FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Continuing Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter to issue further orders for interpretation, modification, enforcement of compliance, or punishment of violations.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, §§ 6502(c), 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58

provisions.title: Transfer of Customer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or disclosing identifying information of any person who paid money to any Defendant for any credit-related product, program, or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Ban on Sale of Customer Phone Records
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from obtaining, marketing, or selling customer phone records and consumer personal information derived from customer phone records, with a narrow exception for records obtained pursuant to law, regulation, or lawful court order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities
provisions.summary: Defendants are restrained from making false or deceptive statements to obtain consumer personal information and from requesting others to obtain such information through deceptive means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Relief
provisions.summary: Judgment is entered jointly and severally against Defendants for $2,700.00, to be paid by January 1, 2007, with funds deposited into an FTC-administered fund for equitable relief.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Cooperation with FTC
provisions.summary: Defendant Edmund Edmister must cooperate in good faith with the FTC, appearing for interviews, depositions, and other proceedings related to the complaint upon written request, without requiring a subpoena.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For three years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of the Order to all principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, and agents, with delivery within 5 days for current personnel and prior to start for new personnel, and must obtain signed receipt acknowledgments within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Record-Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For three years from entry, Defendants must create and retain specified business records — including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, third-party records, and Order acknowledgments — for any business they majority own or control that deals in consumer personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For three years from entry, Defendants must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, corporate structure, and other specified matters; and must file a sworn compliance report 180 days after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, site inspections, undercover posing, and interviews of Defendants' personnel; Defendants must cooperate within 14 days of written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit to the FTC a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days after receipt of the entered Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 13(b) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against COPPA Violations - Notice and Consent
provisions.summary: Defendant must not fail to provide sufficient notice on children's websites, fail to provide direct notice to parents, or fail to obtain verifiable parental consent before collecting personal information from children.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy Practices
provisions.summary: Defendant must not make any misrepresentations in privacy policies or elsewhere about the website's collection, use, disclosure, or deletion of children's personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy - OnGuardOnline Notice
provisions.summary: Defendant must place clear and conspicuous notices with a link to OnGuardOnline.gov on children's websites in privacy policies, direct notices to parents, and at each location where personal information is collected.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Civil Penalty Payment
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of $250,000 to the United States within five days of entry of the consent decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Deletion of Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must delete all personal information collected and maintained in violation of the Rule from April 21, 2000 through the date of entry of the consent decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Distribution of Order and Compliance Guide - Initial
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide a copy of the consent decree and FTC compliance guide to officers, directors, managers, and employees engaged in related conduct, and obtain signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Distribution of Order and Compliance Guide - Ongoing
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide the consent decree and compliance guide to future officers, directors, managers, and employees with relevant responsibilities for five years, and obtain signed acknowledgments.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must notify the FTC of corporate structure changes for three years and file detailed annual compliance reports for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Record-Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain records demonstrating compliance with the consent decree for three years, including acknowledgments, reports, and copies of web pages and privacy documents.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Provision of Taxpayer Identifying Numbers
provisions.summary: Defendant must furnish its taxpayer identification number to the FTC for collection and reporting purposes.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Continuing Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for interpretation, modification, enforcement, and punishment of violations of the consent decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d); Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b); Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 312

provisions.title: Injunction – COPPA Rule Compliance
provisions.summary: Defendant and all persons acting in concert with it are permanently enjoined from failing to provide required notices to parents, failing to obtain verifiable parental consent before collecting children's personal information, and from violating any provision of the COPPA Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Injunction – No Misrepresentations About Children's Data Practices
provisions.summary: Defendant is enjoined from making any misrepresentation in any website's privacy policy or elsewhere about the website's collection, use, disclosure, or deletion of children's personal information.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy – OnGuardOnline Notice
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must place a clear and conspicuous FTC OnGuardOnline.gov notice in its privacy policy, direct parent notices, and at each personal information collection point on websites directed to children or where children's data is collected.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty Payment
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a $250,000 civil penalty to the United States within five days of entry of this Consent Decree, via electronic fund transfer.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Default on Civil Penalty Payment
provisions.summary: If Defendant defaults on payment for more than ten days beyond the due date, the full unpaid penalty plus statutory interest becomes immediately due and payable.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Relinquishment of Funds Paid
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all dominion, control, and title to the funds paid and must make no claim to or demand return of those funds.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Deletion of Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must delete all personal information collected in violation of the COPPA Rule from April 21, 2000 through the date of entry of the Consent Decree within five days of entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order and Compliance Guide – Current Personnel
provisions.summary: Within 30 days of entry, Defendant must distribute the Consent Decree and COPPA compliance guide to all current officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees and agents, obtain signed acknowledgments, and submit a compliance statement to the Commission within 10 days thereafter.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order and Compliance Guide – Future Personnel
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must provide the Consent Decree and compliance guide to all future officers, directors, managers, and relevant employees and agents within 30 days of them assuming their positions, obtain signed acknowledgments, and maintain those records available to the Commission on request.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendant
provisions.summary: For three years, Defendant must notify the Commission at least 30 days before any corporate structure changes; for five years, Defendant must submit annual sworn written compliance reports to the FTC starting 60 days after entry; and Defendant must notify the Commission within 15 days of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: For three years from entry, Defendant must create and retain specified records demonstrating compliance with this Consent Decree, including acknowledgments, reports, sample web pages, and representations about children's data practices, with individual documents retained for at least two years from creation.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Inspection and Copying of Records
provisions.summary: Defendant must make all required records available to the FTC for inspection and copying within 14 days of receiving a written request.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Provision of Taxpayer Identifying Number
provisions.summary: Defendant must furnish its taxpayer identifying number (employer identification number) to the FTC in accordance with 31 U.S.C. § 7701 for use in collecting and reporting any delinquent amounts.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Continuing Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter indefinitely for the purposes of interpretation, modification, enforcement, and punishment of violations of this Consent Decree.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998 (COPPA), 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), 16(a) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act (FTC Act), 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), 56(a) and 57(b)

provisions.title: Required Disclosures and Defaults Relating to the Sharing of Downloaded Files
provisions.summary: Defendants may not distribute any file-sharing application unless it clearly discloses sharing behavior before installation, requires affirmative consumer selection of files to share, and provides easy mechanisms to disable sharing after installation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Requirements Relating to User-Originated Files and Default Settings
provisions.summary: Defendants may not distribute any file-sharing application capable of sharing user-originated files unless sharing of such files can only be enabled after complete installation, with clear disclosures, affirmative consumer selection, and easy mechanisms to reverse sharing.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Requirements Regarding Legacy Versions
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from promoting, selling, or distributing any Legacy Version of FrostWire Desktop or FrostWire for Android, and must transmit update code and prominent notices to all computers running Legacy Versions within ten business days of the order's entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written reports, document production, depositions, facility inspections, undercover investigations, and employee interviews.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: For three years, Individual Defendant must notify the FTC of changes in residence, employment, and name; all Defendants must notify the FTC of corporate structure changes; Defendants must file a sworn compliance report 60 days after entry; and Defendants must notify the FTC of any bankruptcy filing within 15 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: For six years from entry of this Order, each Defendant must create and retain specified business records, including accounting records, personnel records, complaints, compliance documents, and executable copies of all versions of any file-sharing application they distribute.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Distribution of Order
provisions.summary: For three years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of this Order to principals, officers, managers, employees, and agents, and obtain signed and dated acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit to the Commission a truthful sworn statement acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt of the Order as entered by the Court.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent the extent to which it maintains and protects the privacy and confidentiality of covered information, or misrepresent its participation in any privacy or compliance program such as the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Disclosure and Consent Before New Sharing of User Information
provisions.summary: Before any new or additional sharing of a Google user's identified information with third parties that represents a change from stated practices at the time of collection and results from a product or service change, respondent must clearly and prominently disclose the sharing and obtain express affirmative consent from the user.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Comprehensive Privacy Program
provisions.summary: Respondent must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive written privacy program designed to address privacy risks in product development and to protect the privacy and confidentiality of covered information, including specific organizational, risk assessment, control, vendor management, and evaluation components.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Initial and Biennial Third-Party Privacy Assessments
provisions.summary: Respondent must obtain initial and biennial independent third-party privacy assessments from a qualified professional with at least three years of experience in privacy and data protection, approved by the FTC, covering specified content and delivered within defined timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC upon request various records related to privacy statements, consumer complaints, compliance documents, and assessment materials for specified retention periods.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, and employees or agents with supervisory responsibilities related to the order's subject matter, within specified timeframes.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least thirty days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this order, including dissolution, mergers, name changes, or bankruptcy filings, with notice sent by certified mail.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial written compliance report with the FTC within ninety days of service of the order, and submit additional written reports within ten days of written request by the FTC.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on October 13, 2031, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC or United States files a complaint alleging a violation of the order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act

provisions.title: Injunction Against COPPA Violations
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from violating COPPA requirements, including failing to provide parental notice, failing to obtain verifiable parental consent, making misrepresentations about data practices, and violating any provision of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Deletion of Children's Personal Information
provisions.summary: Defendant must delete all personal information collected and maintained in violation of the Rule from April 21, 2000 through the date of order entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Consumer Education Remedy
provisions.summary: For five years, Defendant must place a clear and conspicuous notice in privacy policies, parental notices, and at data collection points directing users to FTC resources on protecting kids' privacy online.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant must pay a civil penalty of one million dollars to the United States within five days of receipt of notice of order entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain acknowledgment of receipt of this Order from itself, from all relevant personnel and managers for three years, and must collect signed acknowledgments from recipients within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit compliance reports to the Commission, including an initial report one year after order entry and ongoing notices for 10 years regarding changes in contact information or corporate structure.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and maintain records for 10 years after order entry and retain each record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, complaints, compliance documents, and samples of data collection forms.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor compliance through additional reports, depositions, document production, employee interviews, and posing as consumers without prior notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 1303(c) and 1306(d) of the Children's Online Privacy Protection Act of 1998, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6501-6506, 6502(c) and 6505(d), and Sections 5(a)(1), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 41-58, 45(a)(1), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for inspection all documents relating to compliance with this order for a period of five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission within fourteen days of any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the Commission within sixty days after service of this order, and submit additional reports upon request.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or self-regulatory organizations, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the Commission all documents relating to compliance with the order for five years from the date of preparation or dissemination.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this order to all current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Change in Corporate Structure Notification
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or change in corporate name or address.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 60 days after service of the order, and submit additional reports within 10 days of written notice from the Commission.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This order terminates on September 29, 2035, or twenty years from the most recent date that the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, certification by, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by government or self-regulatory organizations, including Safe Harbor Frameworks.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain for five years all documents relating to compliance with the order, including advertisements and materials showing representations, and any documents questioning compliance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Distribution
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to current and future personnel with responsibilities relating to the subject matter, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within thirty days.

provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance through information requests, direct communications, interviews of affiliated persons, and undercover investigations.
